result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Brown

9:57 AM Defendant Marcus D Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Marcus D Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea hearing today. 

State indicates the offer is plea to Cts 1 & 2 DRI in the balance recommending 4-5 years IC 4-5 years ES with Defense being free to argue.  Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 1 & 2- GUILTY. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: Cts 1 & 2 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. PSI ordered. Matter set over for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

of intent to introduce certified public records without extrinsic evidence
of intent to introduce DNA evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marcus D Brown appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Marcus D Brown. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.
